result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert J Daniels Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.
  • Ordinance Violation - Bail Jumping. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Attorney Kennedy to be calculated by Attorney Kennedy and if credit is due to the defendant, it will be onky if revoked and the JOC will be amended.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant may not enter into any bars, taverns or class B establishments.

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample with surcharge assessed.

The defendant must take all medications as prescribed by a treating physician.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert J Daniels in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:23 AM. State - here for a change of plea. Court reviews plea questionnaire provided by Kennedy, looks like the defendant will be pleading G to counts #1, #5 and #9. State - amend #12 to county ordinance of bail jumping with a $1000 fine plus costs and Kennedy free to argue that it should be inclusive of costs, on counts #1, #5 and #9 - plead G as alleged - not a joint recommendation except for what is being plead to, State requests probation of 3 years to counts #1, #5, and #9, counts #1 and #5 - $500 fine on each plus costs and surcharges and costs only on count #9, conditions: 180 days of conditional jail on count #1 only - no objections to a delayed report time, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar class B establishments, employment/school - left to P&P if ordered by the Court, 200 hours of community service, take any all medications as prescribed by medical provider, cost reimbursement of $1360.00 to Forest County Drug Task Force. Kennedy agrees that is what the offer/recommendations would be, has a question about DNA surcharge. State responds. Kennedy makes comment in regards to his recommendation but otherwise what the State said is accurate. State - all other counts needs to be dismissed and read in. Daniels agrees and understands the other counts will be dismissed and read in. Daniels pleads G to counts #1, #5 and #9 as alleged thru attorney. Court amends count #12 to county ordinance of bail jumping. Daniels pleads NC to amended count #12 thru attorney. Court dismisses and reads in all remaining counts. Court finds the defendant guilty of amended count #12. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - reinstates previous recommendations - asking for 6 months of conditional jail time for stated reasons, recommends $500 fine plus costs and surcharges on counts #1, #3 and #5, ask that the money owed to Forest County Drug Task Force be taken first from the bond prior to any other costs. Kennedy states the defendant would like to testify as to why he did what he did - also argues for count #12 's fine to be $1000 inclusive of costs for stated reasons. Court swears the defendant in at 9:51 AM. Defendant takes witness stand. Direct exam by Kennedy. State objects to some of the testimony and direct exam. Court tries to clarify where defense is going. Cross exam by State at 10:02 AM. Daniels excused at 10:04 AM. Daniels makes statement at 10:09 AM. Court sentences the defendant to the following: on counts #1, #5 and #9 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years with conditions of:  #1 and #5 - $500 fine plus costs and surchages and on count #9 - costs only, 180 days in FC jail - report  no later than 8:30 AM on 11/18/15 - huber allowed - credit to be calculated by Attorney Kennedy and the JOC will be amended if necessary, AODA and follow thru, maintain absolute sobriety, no consumption or possession of alcohol, no entry into any class B establishments, bars, taverns, 200 hours of community service total, take all medications as prescribed by physicial, $1360.00 cost reimbursed to Forest County Task Force - use bond on this cost first, maintain/obtain full time employment/school as required by P&P, submit DNA sample with surcharge assessed on count #1, no possession of firearms, no voting rights; count #12 - forfeiture of $1000.00 plus costs - take bond posted, right to appeal, adjourned.
To Kennedy Law Firm from FOSO for service on BAB
BAB, Subpoena and Certificate of Appearance, letter to FOSO from Attorney Kennedy

Defendant Robert J Daniels in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:51 PM. State - here on motion to dismiss. Kennedy agrees. Court has reviewed the motion and denies the portion of the motion regarding illegal substance (THC). Kennedy states part of his motion. State has objections regarding no affidavits to support motion, asks that motion be denied for stated reasons and part of motion stricken that do not have affidavits in support of it, if Court is not going to deny motion outright, State would like to brief the matter. Kennedy responds, disagrees with State. Court responds - denies motion in part but would like some briefing/response regarding transatory issue that counsel has raised. State - no objection to ruling by phone or writing for stated reasons, 20 days to write brief (10/12/15). Kennedy - makes statement. State has sent all discovery on 2/15/15. Kennedy - 10 days to response (10/17/15). Court will review briefs and will make decision either orally by phone or written. Court will have JA contact parties to set for telephonic or video date to render decision if it is not a written decision. Court continues bond, matter is already set for JT on 11/3/15. Kennedy makes statement regarding witness they want to call as they don't know how to spell the witnesses name. State responds. Issue handled regarding witness. Adjourned at 3:15 PM.
Defendant's Second Notice of Use of Learned Treatise
Defendant's first notice of use of learned treatise

Status conference at 09-22-2015 01:00 pm.
Jury trial at 11-03-2015 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert J Daniels in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 11:08 a.m. Kennedy no resolution as of now, new case filed in Shawano county 15CF86 and looking to combine both cases to come to resolve both matters, Shawano Judge to recuse himself and allow Judge Kussel to hear both cases. State - does not object to consolidation but wants it done in Forest County, paperwork has not been produced yet, suggests setting for trial. Kennedy - has had discussions with Shawano DA but paperwork has not been started. State - asks about this case and if they do not have a resolution wants JT. Both parties feel it would be a two day jury trial. Discussion on motions possibly being filed. State indicates all discovery was sent in February. No witness list has been filed by either party. Court would like some time lines in regards to filing some things. Off record (11:16 a.m.) for scheduling purposes. This case will be a back up JT. Court - advises both parties of proceedings for day of trial. Witness lists to be filed by the State by 7-24-15 and Kennedy to file 20 days after states filing. MIL to be filed by August 20th.  Jury trial scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Robert J Daniels in court with attorney Robert A Kennedy.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:51 PM. State calls Investigator Thomas Robinson. Kennedy requests sequestration of witnesses. Court so orders. Robinson sworn in at 2:52 PM. State offers exhibit #1, received after no objections. Direct exam by State. Cross exam by Kennedy - Kennedy asks for adjournment of PH for stated reasons (audio/visual tapes). State disagrees for stated reasons. Court reviews 901.07. Court denies request for adjournment/objection for stated reasons after reviewing statute. Cross exam continues by Kennedy. State objects - relevance - sustained (3:10 PM). State objects - relevance - sustained (3:12 PM). Robinson excused. State rests - relies on testimony. Kennedy again asking for the productions of the audio/visual tapes referrred to. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors complaint. Kennedy has Information, waives reading of it, proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond, and sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 11:15 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on December 11, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 9:04 AM. Robert Daniels Jr appears in person and with counsel Robert Kennedy Jr. State appears by Charles Simono. Kennedy has complaint, waives reading, set for PH. Kennedy - would like signature bond. State objects for stated reasons. Kennedy makes statement, will waive time limits for PH. Court continues bond, set for PH on 12/11/14 at 3:00 PM.
Initial appearance on October 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert J Daniels appears via video from FC jail, Attorney Robert A Kennedy appears in person.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FTR Recorded. Called 1:27 PM Bond hearing at request from Attorney Kennedy. State request $3000 cash bond, not a flight risk but considers danger to community, informs court of prior and current charges, no consumption of alcohol. Kennedy would like $2000 cash. Mr. Daniels cannot afford to post $3000. Court sets bond at $2500 with no consumption of alcohol. Set for INIT on 10/15/14 at 9:00 am.  Initial appearance scheduled for October 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.
